channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: ArcheType: A Novel Framework for Open-Source Column Type Annotation using Large Language Models
item.description: We introduce ArcheType, a simple, practical method for context sampling, prompt serialization, model querying, and label remapping, which enables large language models to solve column type annotation problems in a fully zero-shot manner.

item.title: Reproducibility in Multiple Instance Learning: A Case For Algorithmic Unit Tests
item.description: They are able to learn anti-correlated instances, i. e., defaulting to "positive" labels until seeing a negative counter-example, which should not be possible for a correct MIL model.

item.title: Train Once, Get a Family: State-Adaptive Balances for Offline-to-Online Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Existing solutions tackle this problem by imposing a policy constraint on the policy improvement objective in both offline and online learning.

item.title: 3D-Aware Visual Question Answering about Parts, Poses and Occlusions
item.description: In this work, we introduce the task of 3D-aware VQA, which focuses on challenging questions that require a compositional reasoning over the 3D structure of visual scenes.

item.title: What You See Is What You Detect: Towards better Object Densification in 3D detection
item.description: Considering that our approach focuses only on the visible part of the foreground objects to achieve accurate 3D detection, we named our method What You See Is What You Detect (WYSIWYD).

item.title: Robustness of Algorithms for Causal Structure Learning to Hyperparameter Choice
item.description: We find that, while the choice of algorithm remains crucial to obtaining state-of-the-art performance, hyperparameter selection in ensemble settings strongly influences the choice of algorithm, in that a poor choice of hyperparameters can lead to analysts using algorithms which do not give state-of-the-art performance for their data.

item.title: INA: An Integrative Approach for Enhancing Negotiation Strategies with Reward-Based Dialogue System
item.description: We employ a set of novel rewards, specifically tailored for the negotiation task to train our Negotiation Agent, termed as the Integrative Negotiation Agent (INA).

item.title: FP8-LM: Training FP8 Large Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we explore FP8 low-bit data formats for efficient training of large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Image Clustering Conditioned on Text Criteria
item.description: Classical clustering methods do not provide users with direct control of the clustering results, and the clustering results may not be consistent with the relevant criterion that a user has in mind.

item.title: How Re-sampling Helps for Long-Tail Learning?
item.description: To prevent the learning of spurious correlations, we propose a new context shift augmentation module that generates diverse training images for the tail class by maintaining a context bank extracted from the head-class images.

item.title: Knowledge Corpus Error in Question Answering
item.description: This error arises when the knowledge corpus used for retrieval is only a subset of the entire string space, potentially excluding more helpful passages that exist outside the corpus.

item.title: OpinSummEval: Revisiting Automated Evaluation for Opinion Summarization
item.description: Opinion summarization sets itself apart from other types of summarization tasks due to its distinctive focus on aspects and sentiments.

item.title: Does Role-Playing Chatbots Capture the Character Personalities? Assessing Personality Traits for Role-Playing Chatbots
item.description: Given the "stimulus-response" nature of chatbots, this paper unveils an innovative open-ended interview-style approach for personality assessment on role-playing chatbots, which offers a richer comprehension of their intrinsic personalities.

item.title: SmooSeg: Smoothness Prior for Unsupervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Unsupervised semantic segmentation is a challenging task that segments images into semantic groups without manual annotation.

item.title: Detrimental Contexts in Open-Domain Question Answering
item.description: However, counter-intuitively, too much context can have a negative impact on the model when evaluated on common question answering (QA) datasets.

item.title: A Comprehensive and Reliable Feature Attribution Method: Double-sided Remove and Reconstruct (DoRaR)
item.description: While avoiding the artifacts problem, this new category suffers from the Encoding Prediction in the Explanation (EPITE) problem, in which the predictor's decisions rely not on the features, but on the masks that selects those features.

item.title: Mind the Gap: Automated Corpus Creation for Enthymeme Detection and Reconstruction in Learner Arguments
item.description: Writing strong arguments can be challenging for learners.

item.title: Qilin-Med-VL: Towards Chinese Large Vision-Language Model for General Healthcare
item.description: This method enhances the model's ability to generate medical captions and answer complex medical queries.

item.title: Learning to Search Feasible and Infeasible Regions of Routing Problems with Flexible Neural k-Opt
item.description: In this paper, we present Neural k-Opt (NeuOpt), a novel learning-to-search (L2S) solver for routing problems.

item.title: Adversarial Anomaly Detection using Gaussian Priors and Nonlinear Anomaly Scores
item.description: Anomaly detection in imbalanced datasets is a frequent and crucial problem, especially in the medical domain where retrieving and labeling irregularities is often expensive.

item.title: ViCLEVR: A Visual Reasoning Dataset and Hybrid Multimodal Fusion Model for Visual Question Answering in Vietnamese
item.description: Neural models for VQA have made remarkable progress on large-scale datasets, with a primary focus on resource-rich languages like English.

item.title: Instance Segmentation under Occlusions via Location-aware Copy-Paste Data Augmentation
item.description: Given the modest size of the dataset and the highly deformable nature of the objects to be segmented, this challenge demands the application of robust data augmentation techniques and wisely-chosen deep learning architectures.

item.title: SOUL: Towards Sentiment and Opinion Understanding of Language
item.description: These findings underscore the challenging nature of the SOUL task for existing models, emphasizing the need for further advancements in sentiment analysis to address its complexities.

item.title: LipSim: A Provably Robust Perceptual Similarity Metric
item.description: On the other hand, as perceptual metrics rely on neural networks, there is a growing concern regarding their resilience, given the established vulnerability of neural networks to adversarial attacks.

item.title: ASPIRO: Any-shot Structured Parsing-error-Induced ReprOmpting for Consistent Data-to-Text Generation
item.description: We present ASPIRO, an approach for structured data verbalisation into short template sentences in zero to few-shot settings.

item.title: Transformers as Graph-to-Graph Models
item.description: We argue that Transformers are essentially graph-to-graph models, with sequences just being a special case.

item.title: End-to-end Video Gaze Estimation via Capturing Head-face-eye Spatial-temporal Interaction Context
item.description: In this letter, we propose a new method, Multi-Clue Gaze (MCGaze), to facilitate video gaze estimation via capturing spatial-temporal interaction context among head, face, and eye in an end-to-end learning way, which has not been well concerned yet.

item.title: Chain-of-Choice Hierarchical Policy Learning for Conversational Recommendation
item.description: Conversational Recommender Systems (CRS) illuminate user preferences via multi-round interactive dialogues, ultimately navigating towards precise and satisfactory recommendations.

item.title: Large language models for aspect-based sentiment analysis
item.description: We assess the performance of GPT-4 and GPT-3. 5 in zero shot, few shot and fine-tuned settings on the aspect-based sentiment analysis (ABSA) task.

item.title: DELPHI: Data for Evaluating LLMs' Performance in Handling Controversial Issues
item.description: Controversy is a reflection of our zeitgeist, and an important aspect to any discourse.

item.title: From Values to Opinions: Predicting Human Behaviors and Stances Using Value-Injected Large Language Models
item.description: Being able to predict people's opinions on issues and behaviors in realistic scenarios can be helpful in various domains, such as politics and marketing.

item.title: Revising with a Backward Glance: Regressions and Skips during Reading as Cognitive Signals for Revision Policies in Incremental Processing
item.description: In NLP, incremental processors produce output in instalments, based on incoming prefixes of the linguistic input.

item.title: Diversifying Spatial-Temporal Perception for Video Domain Generalization
item.description: Video domain generalization aims to learn generalizable video classification models for unseen target domains by training in a source domain.

item.title: Pitfalls in Language Models for Code Intelligence: A Taxonomy and Survey
item.description: After carefully examining these studies, we designed a taxonomy of pitfalls in LM4Code research and conducted a systematic study to summarize the issues, implications, current solutions, and challenges of different pitfalls for LM4Code systems.

item.title: Joint Entity and Relation Extraction with Span Pruning and Hypergraph Neural Networks
item.description: Also, most of current ERE models do not take into account higher-order interactions between multiple entities and relations, while higher-order modeling could be beneficial. In this work, we propose HyperGraph neural network for ERE ($\hgnn{}$), which is built upon the PL-marker (a state-of-the-art marker-based pipleline model).

item.title: Test-time Augmentation for Factual Probing
item.description: Factual probing is a method that uses prompts to test if a language model "knows" certain world knowledge facts.

item.title: ACT-SQL: In-Context Learning for Text-to-SQL with Automatically-Generated Chain-of-Thought
item.description: Recently Large Language Models (LLMs) have been proven to have strong abilities in various domains and tasks.

item.title: Where you go is who you are -- A study on machine learning based semantic privacy attacks
item.description: Concerns about data privacy are omnipresent, given the increasing usage of digital applications and their underlying business model that includes selling user data.

item.title: BEVContrast: Self-Supervision in BEV Space for Automotive Lidar Point Clouds
item.description: We present a surprisingly simple and efficient method for self-supervision of 3D backbone on automotive Lidar point clouds.

item.title: Fast Scalable and Accurate Discovery of DAGs Using the Best Order Score Search and Grow-Shrink Trees
item.description: However, the accuracy and execution time of learning algorithms generally struggle to scale to problems with hundreds of highly connected variables -- for instance, recovering brain networks from fMRI data.

item.title: Codebook Features: Sparse and Discrete Interpretability for Neural Networks
item.description: In this setting, our approach overcomes the superposition problem by assigning states to distinct codes, and we find that we can make the neural network behave as if it is in a different state by activating the code for that state.

item.title: Circuit as Set of Points
item.description: In our work, we propose a novel perspective for circuit design by treating circuit components as point clouds and using Transformer-based point cloud perception methods to extract features from the circuit.

item.title: Outlier Dimensions Encode Task-Specific Knowledge
item.description: Representations from large language models (LLMs) are known to be dominated by a small subset of dimensions with exceedingly high variance.

item.title: Utilizing Language Models for Energy Load Forecasting
item.description: Energy load forecasting plays a crucial role in optimizing resource allocation and managing energy consumption in buildings and cities.

item.title: Counterfactual-Augmented Importance Sampling for Semi-Offline Policy Evaluation
item.description: In applying reinforcement learning (RL) to high-stakes domains, quantitative and qualitative evaluation using observational data can help practitioners understand the generalization performance of new policies.

item.title: Scale-Adaptive Feature Aggregation for Efficient Space-Time Video Super-Resolution
item.description: The Space-Time Video Super-Resolution (STVSR) task aims to enhance the visual quality of videos, by simultaneously performing video frame interpolation (VFI) and video super-resolution (VSR).

item.title: A Deep Learning Approach to Teeth Segmentation and Orientation from Panoramic X-rays
item.description: The proposed model's accuracy and versatility offer promising prospects for improving dental diagnoses, treatment planning, and personalized healthcare in the oral domain.

item.title: Evaluating Bias and Fairness in Gender-Neutral Pretrained Vision-and-Language Models
item.description: We quantify bias amplification in pretraining and after fine-tuning on three families of vision-and-language models.

item.title: Detection Defenses: An Empty Promise against Adversarial Patch Attacks on Optical Flow
item.description: In this paper, we thoroughly examine the currently available detect-and-remove defenses ILP and LGS for a wide selection of state-of-the-art optical flow methods, and illuminate their side effects on the quality and robustness of the final flow predictions.

item.title: Lookup Table meets Local Laplacian Filter: Pyramid Reconstruction Network for Tone Mapping
item.description: Furthermore, we utilize local Laplacian filters to refine the edge details in the high-frequency components in an adaptive manner.
